_prev_prog_3.TR_OtherType: Operator Training / Process Plant Operations / HAZWOPER

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
HILCORP ENERGY COMPANY
OLD OCEAN GAS PLANT

1.  Facility accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

     In this process and distribution facility, the plant handles propane and natural gas liquids (NGL) containing:
propane, butane, iso-butane, iso-pentane, and pentane, which are considered hazardous by EPA.  The same properties that make propane and NGL valuable as a fuel also makes them necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling propane and NGL to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to employees personal health as well as our co-workers, and to reduce the threat to nearby members of the community.  It is the policy of HILCORP ENERGY COMPANY to adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and local rules and regulations.  Safety depends upon the manner in which we handle propane and NGL combined with the safety devices inherent in the design of this facility combined with the safe handling and procedures that we use and the training of our personnel.
     Our emergency response program is based upon OSHA's Process Safety Management regulations.  The 
emergency response plan includes procedures for notification of the local and state notification of any potentially affected neighbors.

2.  Facility description and regulated substances handled:

     The primary purpose of this facility is to process and distribute propane, natural gas liquids (NGL), and other products to wholesale customers.  Propane used in the refrigeration unit is stored in Tank 60, a horizontal pressurized tank.  The capacity of the propane tank is 21,000 gallons.  Product (NGL) is stored on site in D-2904, 3700 gallon surge drum; periodically, during upsets, NGL product can be stored on site in two 42,000 gallon horizontal pressurized storage tanks, Tank 61 and Tank 62, or the NGL can be stored in five (5) 100,002 gallon horizontal bullet tanks. 
NGL product is pumped into the Phillips Pipeline for distribution. Propane for the refrigeratio

n unit is brought in 
by tanker truck. 
     Access to the site is restricted to authorized facility personnel (employees/management) and authorized contractors.
     The regulated substances handled at this process and distribution facility are propane and NGL.  
The average inventory includes 7,000 gallons (approximately 30,000 pounds) of propane and 3,700 gallons (approximately 16,000 lbs) of NGL.  The maximum quantity of propane currently stored at this plant including the propane in the NGL is 114,000 pounds.  The maximum guantity of NGL currently stored at the facility is 84,200 pounds.
 The maximum inventory of propane and propane mixture (NGL) which could be at the plant, including process vessels and storage tanks is 2,740,000 pounds.  The maximum inventory of NGL which can be stored at the plant, including process units and storage tanks is 2,650,000 pounds.

3.  The general accidental release prevention program and the specific prevention steps:

     This process and distribution facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable State codes and regulations.  

4.  Five-year accident history:

     There were no reportable accidents involving a release of propane or butane in the last 5 years.

5.  The emergency response program:

     This facility's emergency response program is based upon OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) guidelines.  Hilcorp Energy Company has an Emergency Response Plan in place to provide primary response service and will coordinate with Federal, State, and local emergency response agency personnel to minimize effects of any incident which may occur at this facility.  Depending on the severity of the incident, additional Federal, State, and local resources may be called upon to assist in the incident response.

6.  Planned changes to improve safety:

     Harvest has adopted and modified the facility ERP to comply with current regulatory requirements and response team standards.
